page.title: 04WAULDBY CURSE.
page.content: There is a story in connection with the farm. In the Middle Ages there used to be a village but it was wiped out by smallpox. The owners then of the farm wanted somewhere decent to be buried if they died of smallpox. So they buiult a Mausoleum. Before they died they had a curse put above the door, so that anyone who broke in would be cursed. When they died they were buried along with their treasure. About fifty years ago three boys broke into the Mausoleum and started to mess about with the bodies and the treasure. A few years later they were all dead. This story might not be true.
